channel.title: Granny Free Throw on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Throwing Muses
item.description: [big]Throughout his entire 15-year playing career, NBA legend Rick Barry was a man without shame.[/big] He won a lot of accolades for his play, and was a massively successful star. But he won that success, strangely, by using a style of shot that most people throw out before they reach middle school. See, Barry was an underhand free-throw shooter, and it worked really well for him: For every 10 free throw shots he attempted during his career in the ABA and NBA, he made about nine of them, a rate that was extremely impressive for its time.
